emailSequences.name: Cold Outreach - U.S. Enterprise Buyers
emailSequences.description: 6-touch email sequence for outbound prospecting to U.S. procurement officers

emails.subject: {{companyName}} + African Suppliers = 20-30% Cost Savings?
emails.preheader: Hi {{firstName}}, quick question about your sourcing strategy

bodyStructure.opening:
Hi {{firstName}},

I noticed {{companyName}} sources {{productCategory}} from {{currentRegion}}. Have you considered African suppliers as an alternative?
bodyStructure.valueProposition: Companies like {{similarCompanyName}} are saving 20-30% on sourcing costs by diversifying to verified African suppliers. Plus, West African shipping to the U.S. East Coast is 15 days faster than from Asia.
bodyStructure.socialProof: We work with {{competitorName1}} and {{competitorName2}} in your industry.
bodyStructure.cta: Would it make sense to have a quick 15-minute conversation to explore if this could work for {{companyName}}?

emails.subject: Case study: {{industryName}} company cuts costs 28%
emails.preheader: Thought this might be relevant to {{companyName}}

bodyStructure.opening:
Hi {{firstName}},

Following up on my previous email. I wanted to share a quick case study that might be relevant.
bodyStructure.caseStudy: {{caseStudyCompany}}, a {{industryName}} company similar to {{companyName}}, reduced sourcing costs by 28% in 6 months by switching to African suppliers for {{productCategory}}.
keyTakeaways: 15-day faster delivery (West Africa to U.S. East Coast)
Better quality control with Broxiva's 3-tier verification
bodyStructure.cta: I'd love to show you how we could achieve similar results for {{companyName}}. Are you open to a 15-minute call next week?

emails.subject: Quick question about {{companyName}}'s sourcing
emails.preheader: Not sure if African sourcing is a priority for you

bodyStructure.opening:
Hi {{firstName}},

I've reached out a couple times but haven't heard back - no worries if this isn't a priority right now.
bodyStructure.question:
Before I close the loop, I'm curious:

Are you actively looking to:
- Reduce sourcing costs?
- Diversify your supplier base beyond Asia?
- Improve shipping times to the U.S.?

Or is your current setup working well?
bodyStructure.breakup: If it's not the right time, just let me know and I'll stop following up.
bodyStructure.cta: But if any of these are on your radar, I'd love to show you how Broxiva can help. Quick 15-minute call?

emails.subject: {{companyName}} - African sourcing resources
emails.preheader: Sharing some helpful content, even if we don't work together

bodyStructure.opening:
Hi {{firstName}},

Even if Broxiva isn't the right fit right now, I wanted to share some resources that might be helpful for {{companyName}}'s sourcing strategy:
resources: [The Ultimate Guide to Sourcing from Africa]({{guideUrl}}) - 10,000 word guide covering suppliers, compliance, logistics
[Africa vs. Asia Sourcing: Cost & Quality Comparison]({{whitepaperUrl}}) - Data-driven analysis of 1,000+ transactions
[AGOA Trade Benefits Explained]({{blogUrl}}) - How to qualify for duty-free African imports
bodyStructure.noStringsAttached: No forms to fill out, just genuinely useful content.
bodyStructure.softCta: And if you ever want to chat about how Broxiva could help {{companyName}}, I'm here.

emails.subject: One last try - {{companyName}} + Broxiva?
emails.preheader: I promise this is my last email (unless you reply)

bodyStructure.opening:
Hi {{firstName}},

I know you're busy and your inbox is probably overflowing. This will be my last email unless I hear from you.
bodyStructure.summary:
Here's what I think Broxiva could do for {{companyName}}:

✓ Save 20-30% on sourcing costs for {{productCategory}}
✓ Diversify supplier base to reduce risk
✓ Faster shipping from West Africa to U.S. (vs. Asia)
✓ Integrated trade finance (BNPL, factoring) to preserve cash flow
bodyStructure.lowCommitmentCta: If any of this sounds interesting, just reply with "YES" and I'll send over some times for a quick call.
bodyStructure.breakup: If not, no hard feelings! I'll stop emailing and wish you the best with your sourcing strategy.

emails.subject: Breaking up with {{companyName}} (but keeping the door open)
emails.preheader: This is officially my last email

bodyStructure.opening:
Hi {{firstName}},

I'm officially calling it - clearly now isn't the right time for {{companyName}} to explore African sourcing, and that's totally okay.
bodyStructure.doorOpen: But here's the thing: I'm going to keep you on our monthly newsletter list ("Africa Trade Insights"). It's actually valuable content - industry trends, new supplier spotlights, trade policy updates. No sales pitches.
bodyStructure.optOut: If you don't want it, just reply "UNSUBSCRIBE" and I'll remove you immediately.
bodyStructure.futureContactPermission: And if things change in 6 months or a year and you want to revisit African sourcing, my door is always open. Just reply to any of my emails.
bodyStructure.genuineWishes: Best of luck with {{companyName}}'s continued growth!

abTestVariants.notes: Emphasize 20-30% cost savings in every email
Lead with risk mitigation and supply chain resilience
Emphasize ESG benefits of sourcing from Africa

bestPractices: Personalize first name, company name, product category in every email
Research LinkedIn to find similar companies they might know
Always include a low-commitment CTA (15-min call, not 'demo')
Track opens and clicks to time follow-ups
Use video thumbnail in email 3 or 4 to boost engagement
